name: A. Problemsolving Log
statement:
Monocarp is participating in a programming contest, which features 26
problems, named from ” to ”. The problems are sorted by difficulty.
Moreover, it’s known that Monocarp can solve problem ” in 1 minute,
problem ” in 2 minutes, ..., problem ” in 26 minutes.After the contest,
you discovered his contest log a string, consisting of uppercase Latin
letters, such that the i-th letter tells which problem Monocarp was
solving during the i-th minute of the contest. If Monocarp had spent
enough time in total on a problem to solve it, he solved it. Note that
Monocarp could have been thinking about a problem after solving it.Given
Monocarp’s contest log, calculate the number of problems he solved
during the contest.
